   20: 
   21: %%
   22: -module(ssh_to_openssh_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include("ssh_test_lib.hrl").
   26: -include("ssh_transport.hrl").
   27: 
   28: -export([
   29:          suite/0,
   30:          all/0,
   31:          groups/0,
   32:          init_per_suite/1,
   33:          end_per_suite/1,
   34:          init_per_group/2,
   35:          end_per_group/2,
   36:          init_per_testcase/2,
   37:          end_per_testcase/2
   38:         ]).
   39: 
   40: -export([
   41:          erlang_server_openssh_client_renegotiate/1,
   42:          eserver_oclient_kex_strict/1,
   43:          erlang_shell_client_openssh_server/1,
   44:          eclient_oserver_kex_strict/1,
   45:          exec_direct_with_io_in_sshc/1,
   46:          exec_with_io_in_sshc/1,
   47:          tunnel_in_erlclient_erlserver/1,
   48:          tunnel_in_erlclient_openssh_server/1,
   49:          tunnel_in_non_erlclient_erlserver/1,
   50:          tunnel_out_erlclient_erlserver/1,
   51:          tunnel_out_erlclient_openssh_server/1,
   52:          tunnel_out_non_erlclient_erlserver/1
   53: 
   54:         ]).
   55: 
   56: -define(REKEY_DATA_TMO, 65000).
   57: 
   58: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   59: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   60: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   61: 
   62: suite() ->
   63:     [{timetrap,{seconds,60}}].
   64: 
   65: all() -> 
   66:     case os:find_executable("ssh") of
   67: 	false -> 
   68: 	    {skip, "openSSH not installed on host"};
   69: 	_ ->
   70: 	    [{group, erlang_client},
   71:              {group, erlang_server}
   72: 	     ]
   73:     end.
   74: 
   75: groups() -> 
   76:     [{erlang_client, [], [tunnel_in_erlclient_erlserver,
   77:                           tunnel_out_erlclient_erlserver,
   78:                           {group, tunnel_distro_server},
   79:                           erlang_shell_client_openssh_server,
   80:                           eclient_oserver_kex_strict
   81: 			 ]},
   82:      {tunnel_distro_server, [], [tunnel_in_erlclient_openssh_server,
   83:                                  tunnel_out_erlclient_openssh_server]},
   84:      {erlang_server, [], [{group, tunnel_distro_client},
   85:                           erlang_server_openssh_client_renegotiate,
   86:                           eserver_oclient_kex_strict,
   87:                           exec_with_io_in_sshc,
   88:                           exec_direct_with_io_in_sshc
   89:                          ]
   90:      },
   91:      {tunnel_distro_client, [], [tunnel_in_non_erlclient_erlserver,
   92:                                  tunnel_out_non_erlclient_erlserver]}
   93:     ].
   94: 
   95: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   96:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
   97:        case gen_tcp:connect("localhost", ?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active, false}]) of
   98: 	   {error,econnrefused} ->
   99: 	       {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  100: 	   {ok, Sock} ->
  101:                ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(
  102:                  [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()},
  103:                   {kex_strict, check_kex_strict(Sock)}| Config0])
  104:        end
  105:       ).
  106: 
  107: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  108:     ok.
  109: 
  110: init_per_group(erlang_server, Config) ->
  111:     Config;
  112: init_per_group(G, Config) when G==tunnel_distro_server ;
  113:                                G==tunnel_distro_client ->
  114:     case no_forwarding(Config) of
  115:         true ->
  116:             {skip, "port forwarding disabled in external ssh"};
  117:         false ->
  118:             Config
  119:     end;
  120: init_per_group(erlang_client, Config) ->
  121:     CommonAlgs = ssh_test_lib:algo_intersection(
  122: 		   ssh:default_algorithms(),
  123: 		   ssh_test_lib:default_algorithms(sshd)),
  124:     [{common_algs,CommonAlgs} | Config];
  125: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  126:     Config.
  127: 
  128: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  129:     Config.
  130: 
  131: 
  132: init_per_testcase(erlang_server_openssh_client_renegotiate, Config) ->
  133:     case os:type() of
  134: 	{unix,_} -> ssh:start(), Config;
  135: 	Type -> {skip, io_lib:format("Unsupported test on ~p",[Type])}
  136:     end;
  137: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  138:     ssh:start(),
  139:     Config.
  140: 
  141: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, _Config) ->
  142:     ssh:stop(),
  143:     ok.
  144: 
  145: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  146: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  147: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  148: erlang_shell_client_openssh_server(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  149:     eclient_oserver_helper(Config).
  150: 
  151: eclient_oserver_kex_strict(Config) when is_list(Config)->
  152:     case proplists:get_value(kex_strict, Config) of
  153:         true ->
  154:             {ok, HandlerPid} = ssh_test_lib:add_report_handler(),
  155:             #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
  156:             logger:set_primary_config(level, notice),
  157:             Result = eclient_oserver_helper(Config),
  158:             {ok, Reports} = ssh_test_lib:get_reports(HandlerPid),
  159:             ct:pal("Reports = ~p", [Reports]),
  160:             true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(client, Reports),
  161:             logger:set_primary_config(Level),
  162:             Result;
  163:         _ ->
  164:             {skip, "KEX strict not support by local OpenSSH"}
  165:     end.
  166: 
  167: eclient_oserver_helper(Config) ->
  168:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  169:     IO = ssh_test_lib:start_io_server(),
  170:     Prev = lists:usort(supervisor:which_children(sshc_sup)),
  171:     Shell = ssh_test_lib:start_shell(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, IO),
  172:     IO ! {input, self(), "echo Hej\n"},
  173:     case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  174:         true ->
  175:             ct:log("~p:~p  ptty supported", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  176:             receive_data("Hej", undefined),
  177:             IO ! {input, self(), "exit\n"},
  178:             receive_logout(),
  179:             receive_normal_exit(Shell),
  180:             %% Check that the connection is closed:
  181:             ct:log("Expects ~p", [Prev]),
  182:             ?wait_match(Prev, lists:usort(supervisor:which_children(sshc_sup)));
  183:         false ->
  184:             ct:log("~p:~p  ptty unsupported", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  185:             receive_exit(Shell,
  186:                          fun({{badmatch,failure},
  187:                               [{ssh,shell,_,_} | _]}) -> true;
  188:                             (_) ->
  189:                                  false
  190:                          end)
  191:     end.
  192: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  193: %% Test that the server could redirect stdin and stdout from/to an
  194: %% OpensSSH client when handling an exec request
  195: exec_with_io_in_sshc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  196:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  197:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},
  198:                                              {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  199:     ct:sleep(500),
  200: 
  201:     _PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  202:     ExecStr = "\"io:read('% ').\"",
  203:     Cmd =  "echo howdy. | " ++ ssh_test_lib:open_sshc_cmd(Host, Port,
  204:                                                           [" -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  205:                                                            " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  206:                                                            " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  207:                                                            " -q"
  208:                                                            " -x" % Disable X forwarding
  209:                                                           ],
  210:                                                           ExecStr),
  211:     ct:log("Cmd = ~p~n",[Cmd]),
  212:     case os:cmd(Cmd) of
  213:         "% {ok,howdy}" -> ok;
  214:         "{ok,howdy}% " -> ok; % Could happen if the client sends the piped
  215:                               % input before receiving the prompt ("% ").
  216:         Other -> ct:fail("Received ~p",[Other])
  217:     end,
  218:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  219: 
  220: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  221: %% Test that the server could redirect stdin and stdout from/to an
  222: %% OpensSSH client when handling an direct exec request
  223: exec_direct_with_io_in_sshc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  224:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  225:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},
  226:                                              {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2},
  227:                                              {exec,{direct,fun(Cmnd) ->
  228:                                                                    {ok,X} = io:read(Cmnd),
  229:                                                                    {ok,{X,lists:reverse(atom_to_list(X))}}
  230:                                                            end}}
  231:                                             ]),
  232:     ct:sleep(500),
  233: 
  234:     _PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  235:     Cmd =  "echo ciao. | " ++ ssh_test_lib:open_sshc_cmd(Host, Port,
  236:                                                           [" -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  237:                                                            " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  238:                                                            " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  239:                                                            " -q"
  240:                                                            " -x" % Disable X forwarding
  241:                                                           ],
  242:                                                          "'? '"),
  243:     ct:log("Cmd = ~p~n",[Cmd]),
  244:     case os:cmd(Cmd) of
  245:         "? {ciao,\"oaic\"}" -> ok;
  246:         "'? '{ciao,\"oaic\"}" -> ok; % WSL
  247:         "{ciao,\"oaic\"}? " -> ok; % Could happen if the client sends the piped
  248:                                    % input before receiving the prompt ("? ").
  249:         Other -> ct:fail("Received ~p",[Other])
  250:     end,
  251:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  252: 
  253: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  254: %% Test that the Erlang/OTP server can renegotiate with openSSH
  255: erlang_server_openssh_client_renegotiate(Config) ->
  256:     eserver_oclient_renegotiate_helper(Config).
  257: 
  258: eserver_oclient_kex_strict(Config) ->
  259:     case proplists:get_value(kex_strict, Config) of
  260:         true ->
  261:             {ok, HandlerPid} = ssh_test_lib:add_report_handler(),
  262:             #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
  263:             logger:set_primary_config(level, notice),
  264:             Result = eserver_oclient_renegotiate_helper(Config),
  265:             {ok, Reports} = ssh_test_lib:get_reports(HandlerPid),
  266:             ct:log("Reports = ~p", [Reports]),
  267:             true = ssh_test_lib:kex_strict_negotiated(server, Reports),
  268:             logger:set_primary_config(Level),
  269:             Result;
  270:         _ ->
  271:             {skip, "KEX strict not support by local OpenSSH"}
  272:     end.
  273: 
  274: eserver_oclient_renegotiate_helper(Config) ->
  275:     _PubKeyAlg = ssh_rsa,
  276:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  277:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  278: 
  279:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},
  280:                                              {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  281:     ct:sleep(500),
  282: 
  283:     RenegLimitK = 3,
  284:     DataFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "renegotiate_openssh_client.data"),
  285:     Data =  lists:duplicate(trunc(1.1*RenegLimitK*1024), $a),
  286:     ok = file:write_file(DataFile, Data),
  287: 
  288:     Cmd = ssh_test_lib:open_sshc_cmd(Host, Port,
  289:                                      [" -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  290:                                       " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  291:                                       " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  292:                                       " -q"
  293:                                       " -x",
  294:                                       " -o RekeyLimit=",integer_to_list(RenegLimitK),"K"]),
  295: 
  296: 
  297:     OpenSsh = ssh_test_lib:open_port({spawn, Cmd++" < "++DataFile}),
  298: 
  299:     Expect = fun({data,R}) ->
  300: 		     try
  301: 			 NonAlphaChars = [C || C<-lists:seq(1,255),
  302: 					       not lists:member(C,lists:seq($a,$z)),
  303: 					       not lists:member(C,lists:seq($A,$Z))
  304: 					 ],
  305: 			 Lines = string:tokens(binary_to_list(R), NonAlphaChars),
  306: 			 lists:any(fun(L) -> length(L)>1 andalso lists:prefix(L, Data) end,
  307: 				   Lines)
  308: 		     catch
  309: 			 _:_ -> false
  310: 		     end;
  311: 
  312: 		({exit_status,E}) when E=/=0 ->
  313: 		     ct:log("exit_status ~p",[E]),
  314: 		     throw({skip,"exit status"});
  315: 
  316: 		(_) ->
  317: 		     false
  318: 	     end,
  319:     try
  320:         ssh_test_lib:rcv_expected(Expect, OpenSsh, ?TIMEOUT)
  321:     of
  322:         _ ->
  323:             %% Unfortunately we can't check that there has been a renegotiation, just trust OpenSSH.
  324:             ssh:stop_daemon(Pid)
  325:     catch
  326:         throw:{skip,R} -> {skip,R}
  327:     end.
  328: 
  329: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  330: tunnel_out_non_erlclient_erlserver(Config) ->
  331:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  332:     _PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  333: 
  334:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{tcpip_tunnel_out, true},
  335:                                              {system_dir, SystemDir},
  336:                                              {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  337:     {ToSock, _ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  338: 
  339:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  340:     ListenPort = 2345,
  341: 
  342:     Cmd = ssh_test_lib:open_sshc_cmd(Host, Port,
  343:                                      [" -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  344:                                       " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  345:                                       " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  346:                                       " -q"
  347:                                       " -x",
  348:                                       " -R ",integer_to_list(ListenPort),":127.0.0.1:",integer_to_list(ToPort)]),
  349:     spawn(fun() ->
  350:                   ct:log(["ssh command:\r\n  ",Cmd],[]),
  351:                   R = os:cmd(Cmd),
  352:                   ct:log(["ssh returned:\r\n",R],[])
  353:           end),
  354: 
  355:     ct:sleep(1000),
  356:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  357:     
  358: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  359: tunnel_in_non_erlclient_erlserver(Config) ->
  360:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  361:     _UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  362:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{tcpip_tunnel_in, true},
  363:                                               {system_dir, SystemDir},
  364:                                               {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  365:     {ToSock, _ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  366:     
  367:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  368:     ListenPort = 2345,
  369: 
  370:     Cmd =
  371:         ssh_test_lib:open_sshc_cmd(Host, Port,
  372:                                    [" -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  373:                                     " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  374:                                     " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  375:                                     " -q"
  376:                                     " -x",
  377:                                     " -L ",integer_to_list(ListenPort),":127.0.0.1:",integer_to_list(ToPort)]),
  378:     spawn(fun() ->
  379:                   ct:log(["ssh command:\r\n  ",Cmd],[]),
  380:                   R = os:cmd(Cmd),
  381:                   ct:log(["ssh returned:\r\n",R],[])
  382:           end),
  383:     ct:sleep(1000),
  384:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  385: 
  386: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  387: tunnel_in_erlclient_erlserver(Config) ->
  388:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  389:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  390:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{tcpip_tunnel_in, true},
  391:                                               {system_dir, SystemDir},
  392:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
  393:                                               {user_passwords, [{"foo", "bar"}]},
  394:                                               {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  395:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  396:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
  397:                                           {user,"foo"},{password,"bar"},
  398:                                           {user_interaction, false}]),
  399:     {ToSock, ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  400:     
  401:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  402:     {ok,ListenPort} = ssh:tcpip_tunnel_to_server(C, ListenHost,0, ToHost,ToPort, 2000),
  403: 
  404:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  405: 
  406: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  407: tunnel_in_erlclient_openssh_server(_Config) ->
  408:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  409:     {ToSock, ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  410:     
  411:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  412:     {ok,ListenPort} = ssh:tcpip_tunnel_to_server(C, ListenHost,0, ToHost,ToPort, 5000),
  413: 
  414:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  415: 
  416: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  417: tunnel_out_erlclient_erlserver(Config) ->
  418:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  419:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  420:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{tcpip_tunnel_out, true},
  421:                                               {system_dir, SystemDir},
  422:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
  423:                                               {user_passwords, [{"foo", "bar"}]},
  424:                                               {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
  425:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  426:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
  427:                                           {user,"foo"},{password,"bar"},
  428:                                           {user_interaction, false}]),
  429:     {ToSock, ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  430:     
  431:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  432:     {ok,ListenPort} = ssh:tcpip_tunnel_from_server(C, ListenHost,0, ToHost,ToPort, 5000),
  433: 
  434:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  435: 
  436: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  437: tunnel_out_erlclient_openssh_server(_Config) ->
  438:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  439:     {ToSock, ToHost, ToPort} = tunneling_listner(),
  440:     
  441:     ListenHost = {127,0,0,1},
  442:     {ok,ListenPort} = ssh:tcpip_tunnel_from_server(C, ListenHost,0, ToHost,ToPort, 5000),
  443: 
  444:     test_tunneling(ToSock, ListenHost, ListenPort).
  445: 
  446: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  447: %%% Internal functions -----------------------------------------------
  448: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  449: tunneling_listner() ->
  450:     {ok,LSock} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
  451:     {ok, {LHost,LPort}} = inet:sockname(LSock),
  452:     {LSock, LHost, LPort}.
  453: 
  454: test_tunneling(ListenSocket, Host, Port) ->
  455:     {ok,Client1} = gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
  456:     {ok,Server1} = gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket),
  457:     {ok,Client2} = gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
  458:     {ok,Server2} = gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket),
  459:     send_rcv("Hi!", Client1, Server1),
  460:     send_rcv("Happy to see you!", Server1, Client1),
  461:     send_rcv("Hi, you to!", Client2, Server2),
  462:     send_rcv("Happy to see you also!", Server2, Client2),
  463:     close_and_check(Client1, Server1),
  464:     send_rcv("Still there?", Client2, Server2),
  465:     send_rcv("Yes!", Server2, Client2),
  466:     close_and_check(Server2, Client2).
  467:     
  468:     
  469: close_and_check(OneSide, OtherSide) ->
  470:     ok = gen_tcp:close(OneSide),
  471:     ok = chk_closed(OtherSide).
  472:     
  473:     
  474: chk_closed(Sock) ->
  475:     chk_closed(Sock, 0).
  476: chk_closed(Sock, Timeout) ->
  477:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0, Timeout) of
  478:         {error,closed} ->
  479:             ok;
  480:         {error,timeout} ->
  481:             chk_closed(Sock, 2*max(Timeout,250));
  482:         Other ->
  483:             Other
  484:     end.
  485:     
  486: send_rcv(Txt, From, To) ->
  487:     ct:log("Send ~p from ~p to ~p", [Txt, From, To]),
  488:     ok = gen_tcp:send(From, Txt),
  489:     ct:log("Recv ~p on ~p", [Txt, To]),
  490:     {ok,Txt} = gen_tcp:recv(To, 0, 5000),
  491:     ok.    
  492: 
  493: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  494: receive_data(Data, Conn) ->
  495:     receive
  496: 	Info when is_binary(Info) ->
  497: 	    Lines = string:tokens(binary_to_list(Info), "\r\n "),
  498: 	    case lists:member(Data, Lines) of
  499: 		true ->
  500: 		    ct:log("~p:~p  Expected result ~p found in lines: ~p~n", [?MODULE,?LINE,Data,Lines]),
  501: 		    ok;
  502: 		false ->
  503: 		    ct:log("~p:~p  Extra info: ~p~n", [?MODULE,?LINE,Info]),
  504: 		    receive_data(Data, Conn)
  505: 	    end;
  506: 	Other ->
  507: 	    ct:log("~p:~p  Unexpected: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  508: 	    receive_data(Data, Conn)
  509:     after
  510: 	30000 ->
  511:              {State, _} = case Conn of
  512:                               undefined -> {'??','??'};
  513:                               _ -> sys:get_state(Conn)
  514:                           end,
  515:             ct:log("timeout ~p:~p~nExpect ~p~nState = ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Data,State]),
  516:             ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  517:     end.	
  518: 
  519: receive_logout() ->
  520:     receive
  521: 	<<"logout">> ->
  522: 	    extra_logout(),
  523: 	    receive
  524: 		<<"Connection closed">> ->
  525: 		    ok
  526: 	    after 
  527: 		30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  528: 	    end;
  529: 	Info ->
  530: 	    ct:log("Extra info when logging out: ~p~n", [Info]),
  531: 	    receive_logout()
  532:     after 
  533: 	30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  534:     end.
  535: 
  536: 
  537: receive_normal_exit(Shell) ->
  538:     receive_exit(Shell, fun(Reason) -> Reason == normal end).
  539: 
  540: 
  541: receive_exit(Shell, F) when is_function(F,1) ->
  542:     receive
  543:         {'EXIT', Shell, Reason} ->
  544:             case F(Reason) of
  545:                 true ->
  546:                     ok;
  547:                 false ->
  548:                     ct:fail({unexpected_exit, Reason})
  549:             end;
  550: 
  551:         <<"\r\n">> ->
  552:             receive_normal_exit(Shell);
  553: 
  554:         Other ->
  555:             ct:fail({unexpected_msg, Other})
  556: 
  557:         after 
  558: 	30000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  559:     end.
  560: 
  561: 
  562: extra_logout() ->
  563:     receive 	
  564: 	<<"logout">> ->
  565: 	    ok
  566:     after 500 -> 
  567: 	    ok
  568:     end.
  569: 
  570: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
  571: no_forwarding(Config) ->
  572:     %%% Check if the ssh of the OS has tunneling enabled
  573:     _UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  574:     Cmnd = ["ssh "
  575:             " -o UserKnownHostsFile=", "/dev/null",
  576:             " -o CheckHostIP=no"
  577:             " -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
  578:             " -R 0:localhost:4567 localhost exit"],
  579:     FailRegExp =
  580:         "Port forwarding is disabled"
  581:         "|remote port forwarding failed"
  582:         "|Bad.*specification"
  583:         "|Bad forwarding port",
  584:     {Result,TheText} =
  585:         try
  586:             Parent = self(),
  587:             Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  588:                                 Parent ! {self(), os:cmd(Cmnd)}
  589:                         end),
  590:             receive
  591:                 {Pid, Txt} ->
  592:                     case re:run(Txt, FailRegExp) of
  593:                         {match,_} -> {true,Txt};
  594:                         _ -> {false,Txt}
  595:                 end
  596:         after 10000 ->
  597:                 ct:log("*** TIMEOUT ***",[]),
  598:                 {true,""}
  599:         end
  600:     catch C:E:S ->
  601:             ct:log("Exception in no_forwarding():~n~p:~p~n~p~n", [C,E,S]),
  602:             {true, ""}
  603:     end,
  604:     ct:log("---- os:cmd(~p) returned:~n~s~n"
  605:            "~n"
  606:            "---- Checking with regexp~n"
  607:            "~p~n"
  608:            "~n"
  609:            "---- The function no_forwarding() returns ~p",
  610:            [Cmnd,TheText, FailRegExp, Result]),
  611:     Result.
  612: 
  613: check_kex_strict(Sock) ->
  614:     %% Send some version, in order to receive KEXINIT from server
  615:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, "SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_9.5\r\n"),
  616:     ct:sleep(100),
  617:     {ok, Packet} = gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0),
  618:     case string:find(Packet, ?kex_strict_s) of
  619:         nomatch ->
  620:             ct:log("KEX strict NOT supported by local OpenSSH"),
  621:             false;
  622:         _ ->
  623:             ct:log("KEX strict supported by local OpenSSH"),
  624:             true
  625:     end.
